hints.content:
Irene did $\purpleC8$ push-ups a day.

She did $\greenD{48}$ total push-ups.

[[☃ image 1]]

How many $\blueD{\text{groups}}$ are there?

options.alt: A tape diagram with 2 tapes of unequal lengths, a first tape labeled 48 and a shorter second tape with one part labeled 8. A curved bracket across the bottom and the width of the first tape is labeled with a question mark and the words equal groups. !

hints.content:
We can write this as a multiplication problem. 

$\purpleC{\text{size of the group}}\times\blueD{\text{ number of groups}} = \greenD{\text{ total}}$

So, $\purpleC8\times\blueD{\text{?}} = \greenD{48}$

We can also write this as a division problem. 

$\greenD{\text{total}}\div\purpleC{\text{ size of the groups}}=\blueD{\text{ number of groups}} $

So, $\greenD{48}\div \purpleC8=\blueD{\text{?}}$

The equations that would help us find out how many days Irene did push-ups are:

 - $\purpleC8\times\blueD{\text{?}} = \greenD{48}$
 - $\greenD{48}\div \purpleC8=\blueD{\text{?}}$

question.content:
Irene did $8$ push-ups every day until she reached $48$ push-ups. 

**Which equations would help us find out how many days Irene did push-ups?**

[[☃ radio 1]]
